Package app.server

Class ServerListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • app.server.ServerListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    public class ServerListener
extends java.lang.Thread
    Main thread class to listen the events from neighbors servers.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Main method for ServerListener thread Execution flow is at is follow: It executes a while-true loop It will listen to any package that might be becoming, given Socket timeout. In case the number of events is 0, therefore no more events will need be triggered, and execution will be finalized. In case packet is EVENT type, it will trigger EventManager.receive(int[], int) to update clock. It will also send a ACK packet to origin host In case packet is ACK type, it will send the packet to internal EventManager.clock, in order to satisfy socket timeout
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread
